meanings.definition: To subject to a penalty or punishment.
meanings.sent1: If you break the rules, the teacher may penalize you by giving you extra homework.
meanings.sent2: The referee will penalize any player who commits a foul during the game.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped my sandwich on the floor, and my cat penalized me by stealing it.
meanings.sent4: Procrastination will penalize your chances of success in the long run.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring traffic laws can penalize you with hefty fines and points on your license.

meanings.sent1: The judge may penalize the company for violating environmental regulations.
meanings.sent2: The school policy clearly states that they will penalize late submissions with a deduction in marks.
meanings.sent3: My dog seems to penalize me with sad puppy eyes whenever I forget to give him a treat.
meanings.sent4: Lack of preparation can penalize your performance in the competition.
meanings.sent5: Failure to follow the guidelines may penalize you with a suspension from the team.
